reviews.title: all in all worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 11 nights in early September 2007 at the best Western St. Raphael. It is in a convenient location and were very pleased with the view from our balcony of the marina . The bedroom is comfortable and clean but not terribly roomy .The bathroom is OK but we thought they could have provided a bar of soap.
reviews.title: good hotel but some disappointments

likes.liked: — view from the room and balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought that breakfast was not only expensive but chaotic. We had to struggle to find coffee milk etc, and some things had just run out and not been replaced. We had to clear our own table in order to sit down in the scrum .After 2 mornings we gave up and bought our own provisions to eat at the table on the balcony , thus saving 216 euros. We appreciated the fact that there was a kettle in the room and brought our own tea and coffee.
reviews.title: OK hotel, but a piece of exceptional service

reviews.text: We tried the restaurant and again were a bit disappointed. The decor is good and some dishes OK but the atmosphere is not particularly friendly. Also would we have booked this hotel if we had known that we would get virtually no sleep due to Wedding receptions. I think not.On one occasion due to a Scottish wedding reception we were awake until 4.00 am ,it was deafening.Is this fair? We paid quite a lot for a room to sleep in!Otherwise it is a quiet area.
reviews.title: Very nice place near the water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The car parking opposite the hotel is fine and the shopping area close by is very useful.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: Just got back from week at the Best Western, La Marina Hotel. Don't listen to the moans and groans about this hotel. It's a great hotel in a lovely area with loads of local restaurants situated around the (very clean and tidy) Port Santa Lucia. The hotel itself is very well turned out. Nicely decorated, very clean and wiith air con in the room which was very efficient. The pool area is great. We did not try the in house restaurant because of the good choices very close by. St Raphael centre is a very pleasant 15 minute walk and would actually recommend this hotel rather than staying more central. Only slight criticism is that the room is a little small but is compensated by a very comfortable bed! Go for a pool or Marina view out of preference. This is a vey good hotel so don't be put off by unjustified negative comments by others on Trip Advisor
reviews.title: Great value hotel in good location

reviews.text: Situated right on the marina, with excellent views (if you get a first floor room with a sea view, which I strongly suggest you request), this hotel is a well run, clean and quiet place to stay.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are restaurants and coffee shops right in the marina, or you can easily walk into San Raphael itself within 10-15 minutes.
reviews.title: A great eco-hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a good size balcony over the swimming pool, with picturesque views of the sea and marina. Other members of our party stayed on the ground floor, and found the room rather dark.
reviews.title: very good standard of accommodation in refurbished, very private ground floor suite.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard of cleanliness in our room was very good, also a really generous sized comfortable bed, and plenty of storage space.
reviews.title: Some like it less hot

reviews.text: The hotel's location is a bit far from the actual city, with almost no views. While the lobby and common areas appear to have been updated, the rooms were not. The walls are very thin and at 9 am we were woken up by someone drilling next door. Go figure! For the price one has to pay, I would not stay here.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.text: If you look up the words "average lodging" in the French dictionary, it will show you a picture of the Best Western. Nothing was outstanding and nothing was poor.
reviews.title: The Basics

likes.disliked: — Blase decor and small rooms. Welcome to value Europe

reviews.title: A long way from the town centre
reviews.text: We never used the pool as it was full of seagulls. But the walk to the downtown center was quick (15 min) and a great view. If you're into boating on the Med, this is definitely a place you should check out. Not much to do in the immediate area, but we ended up test driving a Regal boat from the local dealer in the marina, Sea Different. That was tons of fun, and Alex is a great guy. If you are living in France, I would consider this a viable option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is your standard Best Western, decent sided rooms and balcony. There is a busy pool area and bar as well as free WiFi. There is parking (at a fee) underneath the hotel - the garage could do with some lights and a lick of paint!
reviews.title: Will not stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased. It is modern; not old city small room... but modern big room; had free wifi, had in-room coffee, bathroom was modern [marble/tile modern fixtures], room was clean, common hallway was modern and had nice decor. Very pleased after staying in so many "older" European hotels with small rooms; or hand-held showers, etc... Closely emulated American 4-star. Nice location on marina overlooking sea, had rent-a-car for access... but if no car maybe walk to center city may be too much [if done too often].
reviews.title: About as Good as Your Gonna Get in Europe for 4-Star

reviews.text: But, do not eat breakfast / brunch in hotel's restaurant. We went at 8:30 AM on Sunday morning, expecting relaxing brunch.... 1st when we walked in 80% of the tables had not been cleared; dirty dishes on most tables, had to hunt for ourselves to find clean set up table. Then went up to brunch station and the "primary" scrambled eggs were empty; the fruit salad was empty, and the pancake / waffle bin was empty. We told waiter boy, he said "coming". After eating baguette bread for almost 30 minutes awaiting replenished breakfast bar, it was apparent nothing was "coming". We asked again, and he said "it is coming". But nothing was coming, I got in tiff with him, batted back and forth some choice words, and told them that we should not have to pay for this. Now, to the hotel's credit, when I exited the restaurant and went to hotel front desk, they did in fact give us credit without any hassle.
reviews.title: Not satisfied for a 4 stars hotel
